name: Motel 6 Dania Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here for 1 night recently, as it is close to the airport and usually reasonable. as it was Super Bowl weekend, they had jacked the price to $125, instead of the usual $69 which is the way it goes. however, you should not be bitten by bugs all over your body while you sleep! my doctor has informed me that they are bites from insects. when we awoke at 4am for an early flight, we were shocked at the number of various bugs that were seen when we first put the light on. now 2 days later at home, i am itchy all over and have red bite marks as well. the bedding looked clean, but the bugs sure liked me! to top it off, this happened in december 2005 which i caulked up as "oh well it happens"! the management refuses to do anything about it other than we will get Ecolab to check it out. i can guarantee you it is not just room 284! Steer clear of this place as it is infected with bugs of all types!!
reviews.title: Oh my itchy Body!

likes.disliked: — the bugs that bit me all over!

reviews.title: Absolutely horrible place to stay
reviews.text: I stayed there for 5 days during a conference in Ft. Lauderdale. The room was very smelly and the service was terrible. One day I came back to the room without any towels and the front desk people refused to deliver any. The room was never vaccumed once during my stay. One night the people staying next door were fighting inside first and then went outside shouting. The worst was the following: while I was loading my luggage on the last day and my car was parked right outside my room, someone ran into my room and stole my purse. Because my room was at the end, the person ran out and turned immediately. I could only see the back of the person. The police came and could not help much. If you have to stay there, hire a body guard.

My experience this hotel was similar to the review by Tammy from Iowa. The room was nasty -I wouldn't walk on the dirty carpet with bare feet. There were tiny little bugs in the room and drunk, surly looking people hanging about. I also called the front desk twice, and nobody answered. Don't come to this hotel because of its low prices, it isn't worth it.
reviews.title: Terrible
do not stay here
reviews.text: If you like bugs and lot's of animials in the

reviews.title: Close and 'clean'
reviews.text: trash, then stay here. Management refused to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Motel 6 Dania Beach is the best value overall of just about any lodging I've stayed at anywhere. My wife and I consider it our home away from home when we visit Florida. We've been coming every year or two for the past twelve years and have stayed here every time. Considering the outrageously priced accomodations with not much better locations in the Ft. Lauderdale area this place is a gem! It is only a mile or so from the beach and airport and walking distance or a little more to great restaurants and shops. The pool is immaculate. The staff is helpful and friendly. Parking is easy. The city of Dania Beach is great and a destination in and of itself, a laid-back alternative to neighboring Ft. Lauderdale and Hollywood. Real easy to set out and enjoy these places from here though. We've used this location as a convenient base of operations to visit all over south Florida including Miami, Miami Beach, the Everglades, Naples, Ft. Myers, the Keys, etc. Keep in mind that tons of cruises leave from Port Everglades just a couple of miles away. We recently took a day trip to Freeport, Bahamas. Sometimes we think we should keep this Motel 6 and Dania Beach our little secret but the negative comments on this board are not justified and need to be answered. It is budget priced but it is clean and is certainly better than basic. We just returned last night and continue to say how lucky we are to have found this place!
reviews.title: I really like this motel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Curt Carleen and Cheryl Lilienthal, Saunderstown, RI
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: This motel has typical Motel 6 amenities. Nothing fancy. Just bare bones. Our room was clean and comfortable at the best price in the area. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, although it seemed like the motel didn't have enough people working at the peak check in time. The location is great. The motel has a nice pool area. Quiet. Visible security at night.
reviews.title: Only OK

likes.disliked: — The daily erasing of the room key

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again if we're in the area.
reviews.title: Much Improved over past year

likes.liked: — Reasonable rates, convenient, close to many beaches, places to go.

reviews.text: This Motel 6 has gone downhill since I stayed here a couple of years ago. The grounds are nicely kept. The rooms are smallish and mostly clean, but they have an unpleasant, musty smell. The staff is nice; they pleasantly agree with you while intending to do nothing more than absolutely necessary. The front desk crews act as if you are interrupting them with requests, and they erased the room key daily, necessitating long walks to the desk to get it reprogrammed. There were no ‘Do Not Disturb’ signs provided and housekeeping bangs on the door whenever they roll their noisy carts to your room. There is construction being done on Dania Beach Blvd. in front of the motel. I would not recommend this one.
reviews.title: One word : horrible!

aka: Motel 6 Dania Beach Hotel Dania Beach
description: Motel 6 Dania Beach is located near shopping and dining. Visit John Lloyd Beach State Park, World Fishing Center and Sunrise Casino. Relax in our modern rooms and outdoor pool. Enjoy Wi-Fi in all guest rooms for 2.99 per 24 hours.
